words.meaning: 合用；分享 n. (C)一份；股票
(C/U)感觉；意识；道理 t. 感觉到，意识到

words.example: Curiosity drives people to explore the unknown.
He is aware of the risks of using AI too much.

words.meaning: 清晰的；明亮的；清楚的 v. 清除；清扫；(天气)放晴
错误 vt. 弄错；误解
完整的，完全的 vt. 完成，结束
令人满意的；令人满足的
vt. 防止，预防；阻止，阻挡

words.example: He has a great sense of humor, so everyone likes talking with him.
The Tang Dynasty was one of the most powerful dynasties in Chinese history.
This blue suit really suits you.
The melody of the song is simple but very beautiful.
He ignored my advice and made the same mistake again.
It would be unwise to drive so fast in the rain.
The weather changed dramatically within an hour.
She felt annoyed by the noise outside.
The annoying sound kept me awake all night.
She is one of the most influential scientists of our time.
The building is secure, so you don’t need to worry about safety.

phrases.example: They set out for Beijing early in the morning.
You should be aware of the risks before making a decision.

phrases.meaning: pr. 保护……免受（伤害/损害）

phrases.example: A sense of humor can help you get along well with others.
We went to the station to see him off.
Students should understand the importance of teamwork.
People are becoming more aware of environmental problems.
She cleared out her old clothes from the closet.
He felt left behind when all his friends moved away.

phrases.meaning: 低头；垂下头（也可表示匆忙离开、专心向前）
phrases.example: He put his head down and walked out of the room without saying a word.
Up to now, we haven’t received any reply from him.

phrases.meaning: 把某人从某事中拯救出来，使某人免受某事的伤害
phrases.example: The firefighters saved the child from danger.

patterns.example: I can’t wait to see my grandparents.
He was so angry that he couldn’t say a word.
She is old enough to go to school.

grammar.title: 动词
grammar.definition: 动词

grammar.title: 现在完成时
grammar.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在造成的影响或结果，也表示从过去持续到现在的动作或状态。
grammar.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示过去的动作对现在的影响：I have lost my key. (现在没有钥匙)
表示经历：Have you ever been to Beijing?
表示持续到现在的状态：I have lived here for 10 years.
常与already, yet, just, ever, never, for, since连用

mistakes.wrong: I have see the movie.
mistakes.correct: I have seen the movie.
mistakes.explanation: have/has后面要用动词的过去分词形式

mistakes.wrong: I have bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.correct: I bought this book yesterday.
mistakes.explanation: 有具体过去时间（yesterday），不能用现在完成时

mistakes.wrong: He has gone to Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.correct: He has been in Beijing for 3 days.
mistakes.explanation: have gone表示去了还没回来，不能与for连用

examples: She has already finished her homework.
I have never met him before.
We have known each other since 2020.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的基本结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并对现在有影响
usage: 强调结果或经验
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示完成或经验
examples: I have finished my homework.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生并影响现在的动作
usage: 经验
结果
持续
examples: I have been to Beijing.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时结构（have/has + 过去分词）
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在有影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 强调结果或经历
常与 already, ever 连用
examples: I have finished my work.

sub_topics.title: 现在完成时的用法
sub_topics.definition: 表示过去发生的动作对现在产生影响
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + have/has + 过去分词
usage: 表示已完成的动作
表示经验或结果
examples: I have finished my work.

grammar.title: 主将从现
grammar.definition: 在条件状语从句和时间状语从句中 主句用一般将来时 从句用一般现在时表示将来
grammar.structure: 主句 will do 从句 一般现在时
usage: 常用于 if unless when before after 等引导的从句
从句中不能使用 will 表将来
examples: If it rains tomorrow, we will stay at home.
You will miss the bus unless you hurry up.

grammar.title: 不定式 (to 动词原形)
grammar.definition: 由to + 动词原形构成的非谓语动词形式，可以作主语、宾语、表语、定语、状语和宾语补足语。
usage: 作宾语：I want to go home. / I decide to study hard.
作目的状语：I came here to see you.
作主语：To learn English well is important. = It is important to learn English well.
作宾语补足语：My mother asked me to clean the room.
作定语：I have something to tell you.

mistakes.wrong: I want go home.
mistakes.correct: I want to go home.
mistakes.explanation: want后接不定式，必须有to

mistakes.wrong: He made me to cry.
mistakes.correct: He made me cry.
mistakes.explanation: make/let/have等使役动词后用省略to的不定式

mistakes.wrong: I saw him to run.
mistakes.correct: I saw him run/running.
mistakes.explanation: 感官动词see/hear/watch后用省略to的不定式或-ing

examples: She decided to become a doctor.
It's kind of you to help me.
I don't know what to do.

sub_topics.title: 不定式
sub_topics.definition: to do形式，可作多种成分
usage: 目的、宾语、主语
examples: To learn English is important.

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: to do形式在宾语后补充说明宾语。
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: ask, tell, want等动词后
examples: She told me to wait.
I want you to help me.

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾补
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + 宾语 + to do
usage: 表示将要发生的动作
examples: She asked me to help her.

sub_topics.title: 动词不定式作宾语补足语
sub_topics.definition: 不定式用来补充说明宾语
sub_topics.structure: 动词 + sb. + to do sth.
usage: 常见于tell/ask/invite等动词后
examples: She asked me to help her.

grammar.title: 状语从句
grammar.definition: 在复合句中作状语的从句，用来修饰主句，表示时间、条件、原因、目的、结果、让步等。
grammar.structure: 连词 + 从句，主句（从句可前可后）
usage: 时间状语从句：when, while, before, after, as soon as, until等
条件状语从句：if, unless (= if not)
原因状语从句：because, since, as
让步状语从句：although/though, even if/though
结果状语从句：so...that..., such...that...

mistakes.wrong: If it will rain tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.correct: If it rains tomorrow, I will stay at home.
mistakes.explanation: 在条件状语从句中，用一般现在时表将来

mistakes.wrong: Although he is tired, but he keeps working.
mistakes.correct: Although he is tired, he keeps working.
mistakes.explanation: although和but不能同时使用

mistakes.wrong: Because I was ill, so I didn't go to school.
mistakes.correct: Because I was ill, I didn't go to school.
mistakes.explanation: because和so不能同时使用

examples: I will call you as soon as I arrive.
Unless you work hard, you won't succeed.
He was so tired that he fell asleep immediately.

grammar.title: 可数名词语不可数名词
keywords: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.definition: 可数名词语不可数名词
grammar.structure: 可数名词与不可数名词

sub_topics.title: 可数名词与不可数名词

grammar.title: 常用介词
grammar.definition: 用在名词、代词或动名词前，表示时间、地点、方式、原因等关系的词。
grammar.structure: 介词 + 名词/代词/动名词
usage: 时间：at+时刻, on+具体日期, in+年月季节长时段
地点：at+小地点, in+大地点/里面, on+表面
方式：by+交通工具/方式, with+工具/材料, in+语言/颜色
常见搭配：be good at, be interested in, look for, wait for, listen to

mistakes.wrong: I arrived at Beijing.
mistakes.correct: I arrived in Beijing.
mistakes.explanation: arrive in+大地点，arrive at+小地点

mistakes.wrong: I go to school by a bus.
mistakes.correct: I go to school by bus.
mistakes.explanation: by+交通工具中间不加冠词

mistakes.wrong: I'm looking forward to see you.
mistakes.correct: I'm looking forward to seeing you.
mistakes.explanation: look forward to后面接动名词

examples: The meeting will be held at 3 o'clock on Monday.
She goes to work by subway.
He is good at playing basketball.

sub_topics.title: 介词to和for的用法区别
sub_topics.definition: to强调动作结果指向，for强调受益对象
sub_topics.structure: be important to sb.; be good for sb.
usage: to表示方向或结果
for表示受益或用途
examples: This book is important to me.
Exercise is good for your health.

sub_topics.title: 介词后只能接名词
sub_topics.definition: 介词后不能直接接动词原形
usage: to do中的to不是介词
examples: without water
without eating

sub_topics.title: 介词without的用法（后接名词或动名词）
介词without的用法
usage: 表示缺少某物或行为
examples: He left without saying goodbye.
She passed the exam without effort.

grammar.title: 形容词/副词比较级
grammar.definition: 用于两者之间的比较，表示'更...'的意思。
grammar.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than / more + 形容词/副词原级 + than
usage: 单音节和部分双音节词：加-er（tall→taller, big→bigger）
多音节和部分双音节词：more + 原级（beautiful→more beautiful）
不规则变化：good/well→better, bad/badly→worse, many/much→more
比较级的修饰词：much, a lot, even, still, a little

mistakes.wrong: She is more taller than me.
mistakes.correct: She is taller than me.
mistakes.explanation: tall是单音节词，用-er形式，不需要more

mistakes.wrong: He runs more fast than me.
mistakes.correct: He runs faster than me.
mistakes.explanation: fast的比较级是faster，不是more fast

mistakes.wrong: This book is more better.
mistakes.correct: This book is better / much better.
mistakes.explanation: good的比较级是better，不能用more修饰

examples: My sister is two years older than me.
This question is more difficult than that one.
He works much harder than before.

sub_topics.title: 比较级递增结构（more and more）
sub_topics.definition: 表示程度不断加深，意为“越来越……”。
sub_topics.structure: more and more + 形容词/副词
usage: 描述变化趋势
常用于抽象概念
examples: The weather is getting more and more cold.
English is becoming more and more important.

sub_topics.title: 比较级用法
sub_topics.structure: 形容词/副词比较级 + than
usage: 比较两个人或事物
强调程度变化
examples: This book is more interesting than that one.

grammar.title: it的用法
grammar.definition: it可以指代前面提到的事物，也可以作形式主语、形式宾语，还可用于强调句、时间、天气等表达。
grammar.structure: It + be + adj. + to do / It + be + adj. + for sb. + to do / It + be + adj. + that从句
usage: 指代：I have a dog. It is very cute.
形式主语：It is important to learn English. = To learn English is important.
形式宾语：I find it difficult to learn English.
表天气/时间/距离：It is sunny today. / It is 8 o'clock. / It is 5 km from here.
强调句：It is Tom that/who broke the window.

mistakes.wrong: Is important to study hard.
mistakes.correct: It is important to study hard.
mistakes.explanation: 不定式作主语时，常用it作形式主语

mistakes.wrong: I think it easy learn English.
mistakes.correct: I think it easy to learn English.
mistakes.explanation: 形式宾语it后面要有真正的宾语to learn English

mistakes.wrong: I found that difficult to finish.
mistakes.correct: I found it difficult to finish.
mistakes.explanation: find it + adj. + to do结构中用it，不用that

examples: It's nice to meet you.
I think it necessary to have a rest.
It was yesterday that I met her.

grammar.title: 动名词 (v. -ing作名词)
grammar.definition: 由动词-ing形式构成，具有名词性质，可以作主语、宾语、表语等。
usage: 作主语：Swimming is good for health.
作宾语：I enjoy reading books. / Thank you for helping me.
作表语：My hobby is collecting stamps.
某些动词后只能接动名词：enjoy, finish, mind, practice, avoid, consider等

mistakes.wrong: I enjoy to swim.
mistakes.correct: I enjoy swimming.
mistakes.explanation: enjoy后只能接动名词，不能接不定式

mistakes.wrong: Thank you for help me.
mistakes.correct: Thank you for helping me.
mistakes.explanation: 介词后要用动名词

examples: Reading makes a full man.
Would you mind opening the window?
She is good at playing the piano.

sub_topics.title: 动名词作宾语
usage: 表示习惯或喜好
examples: He enjoys reading.

sub_topics.title: 动名词作主语 + 动词第三人称单数
动词-ing与动词原形作宾补的区别
动名词作主语 + 谓语
动名词作主语（reading books makes...）
sub_topics.definition: 动词-ing 形式作主语，视为单数
sub_topics.structure: 动名词短语 + 谓语（三单）
usage: 表示一件事
examples: Reading books makes people wiser.

grammar.title: 现在分词 (v. -ing作形容词/副词)
grammar.definition: 由动词-ing形式构成，可以作定语、状语、表语和宾语补足语，表示主动或正在进行。
usage: 作定语（表主动/进行）：the sleeping baby = the baby who is sleeping
作状语：Hearing the news, she jumped with joy.
作表语：The movie is exciting.
作宾语补足语：I saw him running.

mistakes.wrong: The news is excited.
mistakes.correct: The news is exciting.
mistakes.explanation: 修饰物用-ing（令人...的），修饰人用-ed（感到...的）

mistakes.wrong: Seen from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.correct: Seeing from the hill, we can see the whole city.
mistakes.explanation: 分词的逻辑主语要与句子主语一致

examples: Look at the running water.
The story is very interesting.
Walking along the street, I met an old friend.

grammar.title: 感官动词
grammar.definition: 感官动词
grammar.structure: 感官动词后接do / doing的区别

sub_topics.title: 感官动词后接do / doing的区别

grammar.title: 非谓语
grammar.definition: 非谓语

sub_topics.title: 过去分词作形容词
sub_topics.definition: 过去分词表示被动或完成状态
usage: 修饰名词
强调状态
examples: The broken window was fixed.

sub_topics.title: 不定式作宾语
usage: 常见于ask, want, hope等动词后
examples: She wants to learn English.

sub_topics.title: 过去分词的三种用法（完成时、被动语态、形容词）
不定式作目的状语
sub_topics.structure: 主语 + 动词 + to do
usage: 表示“为了……”
examples: He studies hard to pass the exam.

sub_topics.title: to do与doing的区别
sub_topics.definition: to do常表示目的或将来，doing常表示已发生或习惯。
usage: 根据动词固定搭配决定
examples: I decided to go.
I enjoy reading.

sub_topics.title: 动词原形与to do的区别
sub_topics.definition: 原形用于助动词后，to do用于不定式结构。
usage: 区分句法功能
examples: You must go.
I want to go.

sub_topics.title: v-ing 作主语
sub_topics.definition: 动名词短语作主语，表示一件事。
usage: 描述行为或活动
examples: Reading books makes me happy.

grammar.title: until 的用法
grammar.definition: until 用来表示某个动作或状态持续到某一时间为止
grammar.structure: 主句 + until + 时间/句子
usage: 表示动作一直持续到某一时间
若主句是否定句，until 常表示“直到……才……”
examples: He waited until it got dark.
I didn’t realize the truth until he told me.

grammar.title: without 后接名词或动名词
grammar.definition: 介词 without 后面不能接动词原形，只能接名词或动名词
usage: 常用于描述缺少某种条件或行为
examples: He left without a word.
She passed the exam without studying hard.

grammar.title: 介词 from 后接名词或动名词
grammar.definition: 介词 from 后面通常接名词或动名词，不能直接接动词原形
usage: 常用于固定搭配，如 stop sb. from doing sth.
表示来源、分离或阻止
examples: Nothing can stop us from achieving our dreams.
This medicine can protect you from getting sick.

grammar.title: instead of 的用法
grammar.definition: instead of 用来表示“而不是”，用于替代某事或某种做法
grammar.structure: instead of + 名词 / doing sth.
usage: 用于对比两种选择
后面不能接动词原形
examples: We went by bus instead of walking.
He stayed at home instead of going out.

grammar.title: 否定词 never 引导的倒装结构
grammar.definition: 当否定意义的副词 never 放在句首时，句子需要使用部分倒装，以强调“从未发生过某事”。
grammar.structure: never + 助动词 / 情态动词 / be 动词 + 主语 + 谓语
usage: never 位于句首时必须倒装
常见助动词包括 have, do, does, did, will 等
用于强调否定时间或经历
examples: Never have I seen such a beautiful view.
Never did he tell me the truth.
Never will she give up her dream.

grammar.title: good和 well 的比较级形式
grammar.definition: (good和 well 的比较级形式)较好的

grammar.title: 强调系动词 be
grammar.definition: 足够……可以做某事（强调系动词 be）
